item1_summary:
Carnival is the largest global cruise company, and among the largest leisure travel companies, with a portfolio of world-class cruise lines . The two companies operate as if they are a single economic enterprise with a single executive management team and identical Boards of Directors . Carnival Corporation and Carnival plc are both public companies with separate stock exchange listings and their own shareholders .
 Sustainable cruising to deliver memorable vacations and build borderless connections . Core values include respect and protect every life we touch, the places we sail and the laws that govern us . We have the courage to dream big, driving innovation and continuous improvement in guest and team member experiences, operations, compliance, sustainability and beyond .
 Each of our brands must carve out a distinct identity for delivering cruise experiences . We care deeply for our team members and must always cultivate an atmosphere of openness, respect and trust . Set the pace with the industry’s smartest solutions that deliver on our sustainability roadmap to 2030. We are committed to providing a welcoming and inclusive environment where people from different backgrounds, experiences and walks of life can succeed .
 We are determined to drive revenue, operate effectively and efficiently at scale, generate record levels of cash from operations and invest our capital wisely . We believe this will allow us to responsibly reduce our debt over time, improve our return on invested capital as well as return to investment-grade leverage metrics . We are investing in technology upgrades and fleet improvements, piloting alternative fuel types and optimizing itineraries .
 Premium experience emphasizes quality, comfort, style and destination-focused itineraries . Luxury experience is characterized by very high standards of accommodation and service, smaller vessel size and exotic itineraries to ports that are inaccessible by larger ships . Cruise industry data was obtained from Cruise Industry News . We compete with land-based vacation alternatives throughout the world, such as hotels, resorts (including all-inclusive resorts) and theme parks .
 Carnival Cruise Line will sunset the P&O Cruises (Australia) brand and fold its Australia operations into Carnival Cruise line in March 2025 . Cruise Support segment includes hotels, lodges, glass-domed railcars and motorcoaches . Cruise support segment includes portfolio of leading port destinations and exclusive islands as well as other services, all of which are operated for the benefit of our cruise brands .
 Carnival Cruise Line is “The World’s Most Popular Cruise Line®” and has provided multi-generational family entertainment at exceptional value to its guests for over 50 years . Princess Cruises introduced the world to the elegance and romance of modern-day cruising . Holland America Line visits over 100 countries around the world and has shared the thrill of Alaska with guests .
 P&O Cruises (UK) is Britain’s largest cruise line . The company's fleet includes two purpose-built ultra-luxury ships . AIDA is the most recognized brand in the German cruise market . It's designed to create a unique experience for guests to enjoy in a unique way of life .
 For nearly 185 years, the iconic Cunard fleet has perfected the timeless art of luxury ocean travel . Its distinct voyages are meticulously crafted to offer fine dining and bars, unique entertainment, and the famous White Star Service® comfort and style . We own, use and/or have registered or licensed numerous trademarks, patents and patent pending designs, copyrights and domain names .
 Bookings are generally taken several months in advance of the cruise departure date . Prices vary depending on a number of factors, including the source market, category of guest accommodation, ship, season, duration and itinerary . We offer a variety of special promotions, including early booking, past guest recognition and travel agent programs .
 Demand for cruises has been greatest during our third quarter, which includes the Northern Hemisphere summer months . This higher demand during the third quarter results in higher ticket prices and occupancy levels . Concession revenues do not have direct expenses because the costs and services incurred for concession revenues are borne by our concessionaires . In 2024, Holland America Princess Alaska Tours earned 34% of its cruise revenues from onboard and other revenue goods and services .
 Carnival Cruise Line has a portfolio of port destinations and exclusive islands . The company has also announced plans to enhance Half Moon Cay, its award-winning Bahamian destination . The destination will allow two ships to dock in the summer of 2026, including Carnival's largest ships that will be able to visit for the first time .
 During 2024, we increased our marketing and advertising programs, driving even greater demand across our portfolio of world-class cruise lines . Each of our cruise lines is focused on creating further brand differentiation and clarity around its unique value proposition . We closely monitor our net promoter scores, which reflect the likelihood that our guests will recommend our brands’ cruise products and services to friends and family, including those new-to-cruise .
 All of our cruise brands offer guest loyalty and recognition programs that motivate future purchases from our repeat guests . Each brand strategically leverages its catalog of demand-generating rewards and incentives to bring repeat guests back time and again with finely honed offers, such as special fares, onboard activity discounts, complimentary laundry and internet services .
 All of our brands have internet booking engines to allow travel agents to book our cruises . We look for suppliers who demonstrate the ability to help us leverage our scale in terms of cost, quality, service, innovation and sustainability . We also employ vacation planners and onboard future cruise consultants who support our sales initiatives by offering our guests one-on-one cruise planning expertise and other services .
 We have established a Code of Conduct to ensure that our suppliers comply with our standards . It also covers sustainability priorities such as sustainable food ingredients, sustainability and sustainability . The code of conduct applies to all of the company's suppliers, including its suppliers, to ensure they comply with the requirements of compliance with the law and regulations .
 In 2024, we had an average of 100,000 employees onboard our ships, excluding employees on leave . We consider our employee and union relationships to be strong. We facilitate trainings to ensure that our teams are well-prepared to carry out their individual and collective responsibilities, as evidenced by the Center for Simulator Maritime Training (CSMART)
 CSMART participants receive a maritime training experience that fosters advanced knowledge and skills development, critical thinking and problem solving . The company also offers training related to liquefied natural gas (“LNG”) technology as well as an environmental officer training program . The main responsibilities of the Global E&C department are to collaboratively:Identify, assess, monitor, prevent, detect and report on compliance risk .
 Insurance premiums are dependent on our own loss experience and the general premium requirements of our insurers . We maintain certain levels of deductibles for substantially all the below-mentioned coverages . We do not carry coverage related to loss of earnings or revenues from our ships or other operations . We are members of three P&I clubs, Gard, Steamship Mutual and UK Club .
 We use a combination of insurance and self-insurance to cover war risk for legal liability to crew, guests and other third parties . Our primary war risk insurance coverage is provided by international marine insurers . We also maintain property insurance covering our shoreside assets and casualty insurance covering liabilities to third parties arising from our hotel and transportation business .
 Our North American cruise ship businesses and certain ship-owning subsidiaries are engaged in a trade or business within the U.S. Depending on its itinerary, any particular ship may generate income from sources within the United States . Under Section 883 of the Internal Revenue Code, certain non-U.S., certain . corporations (such as our North American . corporations) are not subject to U. .S. federal income tax or branch profits tax on income derived from, or . incidental to, the international operation of a ship or ships .
 All of Carnival Corporation’s income is exempt from U.S. federal income and branch profit taxes . However, the state of Alaska imposes an income tax on its allocated portion of our companies doing business in Alaska and certain of their subsidiaries . Cunard, P&O Cruises (UK) are divisions of Carnival plc and have elected to enter UK tonnage tax regime under rolling ten-year term .
 UK corporation tax is not chargeable under the normal UK tax rules on these brands’ relevant shipping income . Relevant shipping income includes income from the operation of qualifying ships and from shipping related activities . P&O Cruises (Australia) and all of the other cruise ships operated internationally by Carnival plc for the cruise segment of the Australian vacation region are exempt from Australian corporation tax by virtue of the UK/Australian income tax treaty .
 The OECD Model Rules provide an exclusion for international shipping income . The implementation of these rules will affect Carnival plc and its subsidiaries beginning in fiscal 2025 . Carnival Corporation and certain of its subsidiaries intend to align into a single tax jurisdiction . We do not believe application of the rules will have a material impact on our consolidated financial statements .
 Our ships are registered in The Bahamas, Bermuda, Italy, the Netherlands, Panama and the UK . The ships are subject to the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea (“SOLAS”) and its International Convention on Standards of Training, Certification and Watchkeeping for Seafarers (STCW)
 We are subject to the decrees, directives, regulations, and requirements of the European Union (EU), the UK, the U.S., other countries, and many other authorities, including ports that our ships visit . Our ships are also subject to inspection by the port regulatory authorities, which are also referred to as Port State Control, in the various countries that they visit .
 The IMO has safety standards as part of SOLAS . HESS has implemented and continue to develop policies and procedures that we believe enhance our commitment to the safety of our guests and crew . The International Safety Manage Officer leads the effort to promote and monitor a strong ethics and compliance culture throughout the company, including all areas of HESS .
 The ISM Code is mandatory for passenger vessel operators . It provides an international standard for the safe management and operation of ships . Vessel operators are required to: .Develop and implement a Safety Management System (“SMS”) This includes, among other things, the adoption of safety and environmental protection policies .
 The cruise line is subject to numerous international, multi-national, national, state and local environmental laws, regulations and treaties . We adhere to standards set by the International Organization for Standardization (“ISO”), an international standard-setting body, which produces worldwide industrial and commercial standards . The environmental management system of our company and ships is certified in accordance with ISO 14001 .
 All our ships must carry an International Oil Pollution Prevention Certificate and a Garbage Management Plan . The ship’s Flag State issues these certificates, which evidence their compliance with the MARPOL regulations regarding prevention of pollution by oil, sewage, garbage and air emissions . Certain jurisdictions have not adopted all of these MARPOL annexes but have established various national, regional or local laws and regulations .
 The IMO adopted a global 0.5% sulfur cap for marine fuel which began in January 2020 . The EU Parliament and Council also adopted the EU Sulfur Directive . The options to comply include the installation and use of Advanced Air Quality Systems, or the use of low sulfur or alternative fuels . We use advanced air quality systems wherever possible subject to local laws and regulations .
 The DCS requires ships of 5,000 gross tons and above to provide fuel consumption data to their respective Flag State at the end of each calendar year . The IMO’s 2023 Strategy on Reduction of GHG Emissions from Ships (“IMO Strategy”) strives to peak GHG emissions from international shipping as soon as possible .
 IMO’s Ballast Water Management Convention governs the discharge of ballast water from ships . Oil Pollution Act of 1990 established a comprehensive federal liability regime, as well as prevention and response requirements, relating to discharges of oil in U.S. waters . The major requirements include demonstrating financial responsibility up to the liability limits set by OPA 90 .
 Most coastal states have also enacted environmental regulations that impose strict liability for removal costs and damages resulting from a discharge of oil or a release of a hazardous substance, similar to OPA 90 . For our affected ships, the incidental discharge requirements are set forth in EPA’s Vessel General Permit (“VGP”) for discharges incidental to the normal operations of vessels .
 In October 2024, the EPA published the final rule on the VIDA National Standards of Performance . The VIDA requires the USCG to develop corresponding implementation, compliance and enforcement regulations within two years . The state of Alaska requires permitting for certain discharges from cruise ships in designated Alaskan waters . There are currently 17 National Marine Sanctuaries and two Marine National Monuments in force .
 The European Commission’s (“EC) strategy is to reduce emissions from ships . The main instruments for reducing emissions are the Emissions Trading System . The ETS regulates emissions through a “cap and rule” principle . The FuelEU Maritime regulation and the Energy Taxation Directive (ETD) are also on the agenda .
 FuelEU Maritime is a long-term framework designed to reduce maritime emissions by increasing the use of sustainable alternative fuels . The regulation requires compliance with the maximum limits of GHG intensity of energy used on board . Proposed amendments to the ETD will introduce new tax rates based on the energy content and environmental impact rather than volume .
 We are committed to providing a healthy environment for all of our guests and crew . We collaborate with public health inspection programs throughout the world, such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (“CDC”) in the U.S. and the SHIPSAN Project in the EU, to ensure that development of these programs leads to enhanced health and hygiene onboard our ships .
 The amount of financial responsibility varies by jurisdiction based on the amount mandated by the applicable local legislation . In Australia and most of Europe, we may be obligated to honor our guests’ cruise payments made by them to their travel agents and tour operators . The UK plans to include domestic shipping under its national ETS beginning in January 2026 .
 The enhancement of our sustainability road map reflects our adaptive approach to addressing evolving environmental and social challenges, both globally and within the cruise industry . We have achieved several goals ahead of schedule, accelerated the timeline of others and established intermediate goals . We voluntarily publish Sustainability Reports that address governance, stakeholder engagement, environmental, labor, human rights, society, product responsibility and other sustainability-related issues .
 We are working to further reduce our absolute GHG emissions from ship fuel by approximately 11% as compared to our peak year of 2011 . We are pursuing our aspiration of net zero emissions by 2050, aligned with the revised IMO Strategy. Achieving this goal will require energy sources and technologies that do not yet exist at scale . We have successfully used biofuel as a replacement for fossil fuel on 6 ships .
 There are significant supply and cost challenges that must be resolved before viability is reached . Service Power Packages (or Power Saver Packs) upgrades are the main part of our ongoing energy efficiency investment program . Upon completion, these upgrades are expected to deliver approx. nmental benefits compared to using fossil fuels alone through their GHG reductions .
 LNG is a fossil fuel and generates GHG emissions, but its direct CO2 emissions are lower than those of conventional fuels . ALS cushions the flat bottom of a ship’s hull with air bubbles, reducing frictional resistance and the propulsive power required to drive the ship through the water . We have ten LNG powered cruise ships in operation as of November 30, 2024 .
 LNG’s advantage over conventional fuels in terms of reduced GHG emissions is expected to grow . The type of tank and system arrangements that we have on our LNG-fueled ships also allows for future conversion to other low GHG fuels such as green methanol . LNG ships are also built with larger fuel tanks, with the space necessary to retrofit for other fuels .
 Carnival Corporation & plc’s GHG emissions inventory management plan follows the guidance in The Greenhouse Gas Protocol and ISO 14064-1:2018 . Our environmental management system is certified in accordance with the ISO 14001:2015 Environmental Management System standard . We use our websites as channels of distribution of company information .
 This document includes market share and industry data and forecasts that we obtained from industry publications, other third-party information and internal company surveys . Cruise Industry News is a for profit magazine company that covers all aspects of cruise operations . We use the most currently available industry and market data to support statements as to our market positions .
